result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T Carriveau in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for James T Carriveau. VWC Rachael Race in court. Defendant waives formal reading and enters NOT GUILTY pleas to all counts. Atty Petrouske request PTC be scheduled in December.

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T Carriveau in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for James T Carriveau. VWC Rachael Race in court. Court makes stmt. Victim rights. Court makes stmt re Atty Petrouske representing as Dean attorney. Defendant wishes to have Atty Petrouske represent him as a Dean appointment and can pay $100/month commencing 11/11/2022. Atty Petrouske agrees to take appointment. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant bound over to the circuit court. Court makes stmt. Atty Petrouske wishes to proceed to ARGN. Court makes stmt. Atty Petrouske makes stmt - his client wishes to proceed. Information has been filed. Court proceeds w/ ARGN.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T Carriveau in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for James T Carriveau. Defendant aware of charges, waives reading and request PH/waives time limits. Present bond cont'd.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
